exercises.title: Understanding Preverbs
exercises.instructions: Choose the correct answer about preverbs and their functions in Georgian.

questions.question: What are the two main functions of preverbs in Georgian?
questions.explanation: Preverbs serve two functions: they indicate directionality (where the action moves) and mark aspect (perfective vs imperfective).

questions.question: What does imperfective aspect indicate?
questions.explanation: Imperfective aspect indicates ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions. In Georgian, verbs without preverbs are imperfective.

questions.question: In Georgian, how is perfective aspect marked?
questions.explanation: Perfective aspect is marked by adding a preverb prefix to the verb (e.g., და- [da-], მი- [mi-], გა- [ga-]).

questions.question: What direction does the preverb მი- [mi-] indicate?
questions.explanation: The preverb მი- [mi-] indicates directionality TOWARD something or someone.

questions.question: What direction does the preverb გა- [ga-] typically indicate?
questions.explanation: The preverb გა- [ga-] typically indicates directionality OUT or AWAY FROM something.

exercises.title: Match Preverbs to Their Meanings
exercises.instructions: Match each preverb with its correct directional meaning.

questions.explanation: Remember the directionality of each preverb: მი- toward, გა- out/away, აკ- up, ჩაკ- into, და- down.

exercises.title: Aspect Identification
exercises.instructions: Identify whether each sentence demonstrates perfective or imperfective aspect.

questions.question: ვწერ წიგნს [vts'er ts'igns]. This sentence demonstrates:
questions.explanation: ვწერ [vts'er] has no preverb, indicating imperfective aspect - the action is ongoing or habitual.

questions.question: დავწერ წიგნს [davts'er ts'igns]. This sentence demonstrates:
questions.explanation: დავწერ [davts'er] has the preverb და- [da-], indicating perfective aspect - the action will be completed.

questions.question: ვკითხულობ წიგნს [vk'ithulob ts'igns]. This sentence demonstrates:
questions.explanation: ვკითხულობ [vk'ithulob] has no preverb, indicating imperfective aspect - this is habitual or ongoing reading.

exercises.title: Complete with Correct Preverb
exercises.instructions: Add the correct preverb to make the sentence show perfective aspect.

questions.question: ვ_____წერ წიგნს (I will write the book - complete action)
questions.explanation: დავწერ [davts'er] 'I will write' uses the და- [da-] preverb to show perfective aspect.

questions.question: ის _____ვიდა ოთახში (He went into the room)
questions.explanation: მივიდა [mivida] uses the preverb მი- [mi-] meaning 'went toward/into.'
